about.title: About
paragraphs: The Integrated Research Laboratory in Geoenergy (LIRGE) is a center of excellence affiliated with the Federal University of Pará (UFPA), dedicated to developing innovative research at the intersection of geosciences and energy.

Our mission is to contribute to the advancement of scientific and technological knowledge in the energy sector, promoting sustainable solutions and training highly qualified professionals to face contemporary geoenergy challenges.
With a multidisciplinary approach, LIRGE develops projects ranging from basic research to practical applications, always aligned with the highest academic standards and social relevance.

objective.title: Objective
objective.description: R&D&I laboratory dedicated to the investigation, development, and innovation of geoenergy solutions, operating in areas such as Energy Exploration and Production, Carbon Capture, Utilization and Storage (CCUS), Well Integrity and Safety, and Geological Modeling and Simulation.

mission.title: Mission
mission.description: To drive the advancement of knowledge and the development of innovative technologies in geoenergy, contributing to sustainable energy transition, safety and efficiency in resource exploration, and environmental impact reduction.

vision.title: Vision
vision.description: To become an international reference in geoenergy research, innovation, and technological development, promoting energy security, environmental sustainability, and the evolution of resource exploration technologies.

research.title: Research
research.subtitle: Our research projects cover diverse strategic areas in geoenergy, always focusing on innovation and sustainability.

1.title: Carbon Capture
1.description: Investigating innovative technologies to reduce CO₂ emissions, promoting sustainable solutions for the energy industry. We focus on understanding risks, operational safety, and process efficiency.

2.title: Energy Exploration and Production
2.description: Researching methods to optimize the discovery, development, and production of energy resources, with attention to efficiency, sustainability, and operational safety.

3.title: Geological Modeling and Simulation
3.description: Using modeling tools to understand and predict geological system behaviors, supporting strategic decision-making in the energy industry.

4.title: Machine Learning
4.description: Exploring the use of artificial intelligence to optimize data analysis processes in geoenergy, accelerating discoveries and improving result accuracy.
